page.title: 02GENERAL VIEW 2
page.content: The northern edge of Yeovil is marked by an escarpment,which rises from the original 'wetlands' of Somerset,drained in the 18th and the 20th century to provide good Farmland. On the highland stands the town of Yeovil,and our block included the northern part of the town.Most of this area is housing-mainly privately owned but with one large Council estate. There is a considerable area devoted to recreation with the{Johnson Park},{ {Mudford Recreation Ground}and School and College playing fields.There is some light industry in the northern part of the town and a fairly good Bus service to the centre. The following accounts were written by second and third year pupils at{ {WESTFIELD COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL}.
